meanings.definition: to carry or pull behind a vehicle
meanings.sent1: Dad will towts the trailer to the campsite.
meanings.sent2: The truck can towts the boat to the lake.
meanings.sent3: The bicycle tried to towts the heavy load but couldn't.
meanings.sent4: The tugboat towts the massive ship effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The strong horse can towts the carriage up the hill.

meanings.sent1: The playground is full of happy towts playing.
meanings.sent2: She picked up the little towts and hugged them tightly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous towts giggled as they ran around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The daycare is filled with adorable towts exploring.
meanings.sent5: The park is a joyful place with towts laughing and running.

meanings.definition: a term of endearment for a loved one
meanings.sent1: Grandma always calls me her little towts.
meanings.sent2: I love you, my sweet towts.
meanings.sent3: Come here, you silly towts, give me a hug!
meanings.sent4: My dear towts, you mean the world to me.
meanings.sent5: In my heart, you will always be my precious towts.
